alert.note: Alert for Gage; Lancaster; Saline (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 9:44PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN LANCASTER...EASTERN SALINE AND NORTHWESTERN GAGE COUNTIES THROUGH 1030 PM CDT... At 944 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 6 miles north of Swanton, or 22 miles northwest of Beatrice, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilber, De Witt, Clatonia, Hallam, The Highway 41 and 15 South Junction, and Olive Creek State Recreation Area. People attending City of Wilber should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
